title: Welcome Home & Bonding
summary: Build trust, start routines, and make training fun from day one.

lessons.title: Name Game
lessons.objective: Puppy learns that responding to their name brings rewards.
steps: Say your puppy’s name once in a cheerful tone.
When they look at you, say 'Yes!' and give a treat.
Wait a few seconds, then repeat 5–8 times.
supportGuidelines: If distracted: move to a quieter space.
If overexcited: shorten the session, end on a success.
lessons.safetyNotes: Avoid repeating the name rapidly or using it for corrections.

lessons.title: Crate Love 1
lessons.objective: Create positive feelings about the crate.
steps: Toss treats just inside the crate for puppy to explore.
Let them enter/exit freely, no door closing yet.
Feed dinner in crate for positive association.
supportGuidelines: If hesitant: start with treats near the door and progress slowly.
lessons.safetyNotes: Never force entry; the crate should always feel safe.

lessons.title: Potty Routine
steps: Take puppy to the same spot every 2 hours and after meals/naps.
supportGuidelines: If accidents indoors: quietly clean with enzyme spray, no scolding.

lessons.title: Gentle Mouth 1
lessons.objective: Teach puppy to control bite pressure.
steps: Offer toy; if puppy mouths skin, say 'Ouch' softly and pause play.
Resume after a few seconds when calm.
supportGuidelines: Redirect biting to toys before hands get involved.
lessons.safetyNotes: Avoid rough tug with tiny puppies; protect children’s hands.

lessons.title: Handling Intro
steps: While puppy is calm, touch ears, paws, and collar.
Feed treat after each gentle touch.
supportGuidelines: If puppy squirms: keep sessions short and pair with treats.
